overview_of_class: The course introduces students to the concepts and techniques necessary to analyze investment alternatives and implement optimal investment decisions. The course covers the effect of time and uncertainty on decision making. Topics include discounting techniques and applications, stock and bond valuation, asset pricing models, diversification and portfolio choice, capital budgeting, and basic option theory. If time permits, additional topics may be introduced.There will be 5-6 problem sets including case write-ups. Students are encouraged to work on the problem sets in small groups.
name: Foundations of Corporate Finance Theory
subject: ECON
